pageContext.claim: “Inconceivable that the government would break into a lawyer’s office (early in the morning) - almost unheard of. Even more inconceivable that a lawyer would tape a client - totally unheard of & perhaps illegal. The good news is that your favorite President did nothing wrong!”
pageContext.analysis: There are slew of falsehoods in this tweet. First of all, FBI agents did not "break into" Michael Cohen's office. They were executing a search order that had been approved by a federal judge. In New York state, only one party needs consent to a recording. That means it is not illegal for a lawyer to record a client. As for Cohen taping Trump, The Post reported in April, it was a regular practice of Cohen's that Trump knew about. Lastly, Trump is not America's "favorite President." At the time of this tweet, his approval rating had dipped to 42 percent.
